Articles.Content:
Hello and welcome! This is where I\'m going to put out my new parts, reskins, what have you. Firstly, one of my favorite new mods is the Orion Drive provided by Technical Ben, but its\' big problem is that, well, it tends to destroy everything that isn\'t an iPlate or a pod when used... so I went about tuning a few parts to be able to withstand the forces involved, and then decided to retex. I\'ll later remodel them. And I plan on actually, I dunno, posting them, later today.

Coming Soon!

Orion SAS

Others!
Cool, look forward to checking them out.

Alright, I\'ve run into a problem. I need to A. Tune the SAS to be powerful enough to handle the OD, and B. Figure out why KSP won\'t load the new texture, even though the OrionSAS part-cfg file tells it precisely where to look. I\'m also working on a hardened Radial Stack Decoupler (for when one stack of nuclear weapons just isn\'t enough).

Alright, I\'ve run into a problem. I need to A. Tune the SAS to be powerful enough to handle the OD, and B. Figure out why KSP won\'t load the new texture, even though the OrionSAS part-cfg file tells it precisely where to look. I\'m also working on a hardened Radial Stack Decoupler (for when one stack of nuclear weapons just isn\'t enough).

Make sure your texture name doesn\'t have an underscore it in (or was it a dash? one of those)

For advanced SAS, start out with a ratio of like

1

2

0.5

And then scale it by dividing them all by whatever power of 10. The bigger the ship, the smaller the number, so you\'d want someting like

.001

.002

.0005 for a heavy rocket

It\'s a starting point anyway.

I\'ve found the problem with the texture on the Orion SAS, and now tuned it. Unfortunately, my flash drive is a piece of crap, and my main KSP file is on my stupidly powerful drafting station at school.... which I will not return to until the morning. However, to make up for it, I\'ll be releasing both it and the ODSP-2 Stack Decoupler tomorrow.

Thanks. Not been called 'Bob' before.

I\'ll be working on some Orion class struts too, just as soon as I find a way to hack my mesh into the game.
